item.title: Scaling inequalities and limits for Robin and Dirichlet eigenvalues
item.description: arXiv:2409.03050v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: For the Laplacian in spherical and hyperbolic spaces, Robin eigenvalues in two dimensions and Dirichlet eigenvalues in higher dimensions are shown to satisfy scaling inequalities analogous to the standard scale invariance of the Euclidean Laplacian. These results extend work of Langford and Laugesen to Robin problems and to Dirichlet problems in higher dimensions. In addition, scaled Robin eigenvalues behave exotically as the domain expands to a 2-sphere, tending to the spectrum of an exterior Robin problem.
item.dc:creator: Scott Harman

item.title: Spectral properties of hexagonal lattices with the -R coupling
item.description: arXiv:2409.03538v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We analyze the spectrum of the hexagonal lattice graph with a vertex coupling which manifestly violates the time reversal invariance and at high energies it asymptotically decouples edges at even degree vertices; a comparison is made to the case when such a decoupling occurs at odd degree vertices. We also show that the spectral character does not change if the equilateral elementary cell of the lattice is dilated to have three different edge lengths, except that flat bands are absent if those are incommensurate.
item.dc:creator: Pavel Exner, Jan Peka\v{r}

item.title: Bounds for Eigenvalue Sums of Schr\"odinger Operators with Complex Radial Potentials
item.description: arXiv:2408.15783v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We consider eigenvalue sums of Schr\"odinger operators $-\Delta+V$ on $L^2(\R^d)$ with complex radial potentials $V\in L^q(\R^d)$, $q<d$. We prove quantitative bounds on the distribution of the eigenvlaues in terms of the $L^q$ norm of $V$. A consequence of our bounds is that, if the eigenvlaues $(z_j)$ accumulates to a point in $(0,\infty)$, then $(\im z_j)$ is summable. The key technical tools are resolvent estimates in Schatten spaces. We show that these resolvent estimates follow from spectral measure estimates by an epsilon removal argument.
item.dc:creator: Jean-Claude Cuenin, Solomon Keedle-Isack
